content: you go avoid k11 k11 your scrap yarn holding stitches as much as possible toy duck ahoy duckie page 4 of 4 working the head round 14 k10 starting at the end of the duck go through the 4 stitches held round 15 * k2tog * on waste yarn on one side then the 4 stitches on the other side remove the waste yarn add working yarn leaving a tail about 8-10 long to use to stabilize the head when done cut yarn thread onto a dull tapestry needle and thread thru stitches stuff head tighten and secure tail use tail where you started the head to strengthen the neck a little then secure and cut tail round 1 k4 k4 making the duck bill leaving a sewing tail and using orange yarn cast on 8 stitches using jmco and work in the round rounds 1-4 k8 4 sts on each needle cut yarn leaving a sewing tail thread onto a blunt tapestry needle and thread through stitches add a tiny bit of stuffing and pull both tails to close use the tails to sew duck s bill to round 2 kfb k1 kfb x2 head kfb k1 kfb x2 making the knots for eyes round 3 k7 k7 taking black yarn i use dk weight - about 10 make a knot below is a video which shows how round 4 k7 k7 https //youtu be/ujedqfduwsw si=fyzy0j3-owhdcz_f if adding mohair add it now sew knot in place using the 2 ends go over at least one thread so the knot doesn t get pulled inside the head as you round 5 k2 m1 k3 m1 k2 are sewing creating an eye repeat for the other eye k2 m1 k3 m1 k2 note - multiple rounds below neck ribbon rounds 6-10 k9 k9 optional - if desired tie a ribbon around the duck s neck if you re using dpns or 2 needles you ll have to move some stitches on the next round round 11 * k4 k2tog * round 12 k15 round 13 * k1 k2tog *
